title: Zip codes for Database on Ideology, Money in Politics, and Elections
description: Zip codes for Database on Ideology, Money in Politics, and Elections. The current data (via Adam Bonica) only contains lat/long: http://data.stanford.edu/dime  Reverse geocoding of lat/longs to zip codes via AskGeo via AskGeo Script posted at: https://github.com/soodoku/Lat-Long-to-Zip

title: Clean Names for CF-Scores
description: Names column in Campain Finance Scores (CF-Scores) is messy:  some entries are lastname firstname, others firstname lastname, yet others middlename, lastname, firstname. Others have a still weirder structure.   The script at: https://github.com/soodoku/Clean-Names was used to produce columns for firstname, lastname, suffixes, middle name/initial.  Original data by Adam Bonica.  http://data.stanford.edu/dime

title: Digital Television Coverage by Postcode in the UK
description:
Data on UK Digital TV Coverage. Quality of signal, transmitter, transmitter group, channels, etc. by postcode.
  • More at: http://www.digitaluk.co.uk/coveragechecker/
  • For scripts used to generate the data, see: https://github.com/soodoku/digital-tv-coverage-in-uk

title: Cable TV Penetration in Designated Market Areas (DMAs) 1983--2010; TVHH and CAHH for 1972--1990
description:
Contains:
  1. Data on Cable Penetration in Designated Market Areas from 1983--2010 from the Broadcasting and Cable Yearbook. Includes original scans (photos) of the pages.
  2. Data on the number of TV and Cable households for 1972--1990 (even number years only).
Note: For a crosswalk between DMAs and other geographic entities (counties, zip codes etc.), see http://dx.doi.org/10.7910/DVN/IVXEHT

title: Warren’s TV and Cable Factbook data (1997--2002)
description:
Warren’s TV and Cable Factbook Data (1997--2002). Data on cable operators and channels offered in each town in the US.
Please read: http://gbytes.gsood.com/2016/09/12/town-level-data-on-cable-operators-and-cable-channels/

Note: Those who found this data interesting may also be interested in:

  • 1996 Scans of TV Stations

title: CNN Transcripts 2000--2025
description:
See: https://github.com/notnews/cnn_transcripts For copyright reasons, access is restricted for research purposes only. The data are split into eight files:
  1. `cnn-1.csv`. Data from 2000/01/01--2000/04/20. No. of transcripts = 7017
  2. `cnn-2.csv`. Data from 2000/04/21--2001/04/03. No. of transcripts = 21381
  3. `cnn-3.csv`. Data from 2001/04/04--2002/08/06. No. of transcripts = 35269
  4. `cnn-4.csv`. Data from 2002/08/07--2002/09/16. No. of transcripts = 2343
  5. `cnn-5.csv`. Data from 2002/09/17--2012/05/18. No. of transcripts = 101336
  6. `cnn-6.csv`. Data from 2012/05/19--2014/06/17. No. of transcripts = 23536
  7. `cnn-7.csv` Data from 2014/06/18--2022/02/05. No. of transcripts = 102458
  8. `cnn-8.csv` Data from 2022/02/01--2025/03/15. No. of transcripts = 43562
Related Data
  • CNN Transcripts
  • MSNBC Transcripts
  • Fox News Transcripts

title: NBC Transcripts
description: Transcripts of some of the NBC shows like the Rachel Maddow Show, The Ed Show etc. b/w 2008--2014. For additional details, see: https://github.com/soodoku/nbc_transcripts

description:
Approval data from SurveyUSA --- 2006--2011.

Approval data from 2,353 polls is parsed and put in a CSV.

description: CQ 1990 Scans for Newspaper, TV, and Cable in the District for Alabama---Kentucky

title: Parsed Indian Electoral Rolls
description:
For getting the pdfs of electoral rolls, see https://github.com/in-rolls/electoral_rolls. For scripts used to parse the electoral rolls, see https://github.com/in-rolls/parse_elex_rolls If you would like access to the electoral rolls, please fill out the following form. You will need to also get IRB approval from your respective university or institution. The IRB-approved proposal should include:
  • Case for why the data are necessary
  • Acknowledgment that the data will be kept in a secure environment
  • All the people who will have access to the data
  • That the data will only be used on projects with IRB approval
  • That data won't be shared with people who are not identified in 3.
  • That publications and presentations will not reveal identifying individual information: only statistical summaries will be presented.

title: Socio-Economic and Caste Census 2011
description:
This data was scraped from: http://164.100.129.6/netnrega/secc_list.aspx
See the GitHub repo: SECC for additional details.
There are two types of files in this dataverse:
1. Final deduped data is uploaded in 2 files with the word deduped in the filename. See the Github repo. for what was done to produce these files.
2. Rest of the files are original files downloaded from the site. They have the word 'clean' in them to reflect minor known deduping.

title: Sex, Race, and Salaries of Public Employees
description:
Sex, Race, Salaries of public employees.

underlying data and scripts here: https://github.com/public-salaries

title: Vanderbilt TV News Abstracts
description: See Github for additional details about the data.

title: Top 10 News
description:
We scraped and parsed the homepages, politics pages, and top10 lists of prominent news sites for 2012 and 2016--2017. We did all this in 2016--2017, and hence the 2012 data exclusively comes from Internet Archive. For 2016--2017, the data mostly comes from scraping live sites but some of the data---where we realized much too late that we wanted to scrape the site---also comes from Internet Archive. 

For additional details, see: https://github.com/not_news/top10

title: Congressional Biographies
description: Congressional Biographies

title: YouGov Pulse Data for 1200 people for June 2022
description:
YouGov Pulse Data on 1200 people for June 2022. (This data seems to have come from RealityMine.)

YouGov had initially accidentally sent data on only 900 respondents. On December 9th, they fixed the issue. I have kept both sets of files up.

title: Closed Caption News Transcripts from the Internet Archive (2014--2023)
description:
Closed Caption News Transcripts from the Internet Archive (2014--2023). The nc- files are ones where the commercials have been stripped out using the data from https://tvnews.stanford.edu/export/commercial

For scripts underlying the data pull, see: https://github.com/notnews/archive_news_cc
